Body: How can I upgrade the OS of my Samsung Galaxy Exhibit (SGH-T599N) from Android 4.1 to 4.4 or higher?I am trying to install Live on YouTube – by Xperia on my smartphone so that I can live stream videos on YouTube, but it's giving me this error message: "This app is incompatible with your device." According to the app's Google Play homepage, which was updated last week, the app requires Android 4.4 or higher. I only have 4.1. :( So, I assumed it must be because of that (please correct me if this assumption might be wrong.) Also, when I press Software Update on my device, I get: "This device is up to date." Could it mean that I may never be able to update it anymore because it's too old?
Title: How can I upgrade the OS of my Samsung Galaxy Exhibit from Android 4.1 to 4.4 or higher?

history.Text: How can I upgrade the OS of my Samsung Galaxy Exhibit (SGH-T599N) from 4.1 to 4.4 or higher?I am trying to install [Live on YouTube – by Xperia][1] to be able to live stream from my phone to YouTube, but it's giving me this error message: "This app is incompatible with your device." According to its Google Play homepage updated last week, the app requires Android 4.4 and up. And I only have 4.1. So, I assumed it must be because of that (please correct me if this assumption may be wrong.) Also, when I try Software Update on my device, I get: "This device is up to date."  [1]: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.sonymobile.camera.addon.livefromsonyxperia&hl=en
